I'd highly recommend "Amen." for you. This thought-provoking film is based on a true story about a SS officer trying to inform Pope Pius XII about Jews being sent to extermination camps during WWII. It stars Ulrich Mühe and Mathieu Kassovitz, known for their captivating performances in this emotionally charged drama.

If you're interested in a more action-packed war film, "Valkyrie" is also worth considering. Starring Tom Cruise, it tells the story of a group of German Army officers who attempt to assassinate Adolf Hitler during World War II. The plot is filled with suspense and political intrigue that might appeal to you. Enjoy the movies!

I'd highly recommend watching "A Farewell to Arms". Based on a novel by Ernest Hemingway and adapted for the screen by Alessandro Camon, this classic war film tells a poignant love story set against the backdrop of World War I. The movie stars Gary Cooper and Helen Hayes in captivating performances that truly bring the narrative to life.

Another great option is "Lincoln" (1995), which delves into the personal and political challenges faced by President Abraham Lincoln during the Civil War. Joseph Gordon-Levitt portrays a young Lincoln with intensity, making this film a must-see for history enthusiasts. Enjoy your movie time!

Based on your interest in war films and intriguing plots, I'd highly recommend "Doctor Zhivago" for its epic story set during World War I and the October Revolution, featuring a cast including Julie Christie, Hugh Bonneville, Keira Knightley, and Geraldine Chaplin.

If you're looking for a more recent film that delves into political intrigue and military operations, "Zero Dark Thirty" might be right up your alley. This gripping thriller follows the decade-long hunt for Osama bin Laden, starring Jessica Chastain, Mark Duplass, Joel Edgerton, and many more notable actors. Enjoy the movies!
